Watch for high fever >103°F, difficulty breathing, or persistent vomiting - seek medical help immediately (WHO).

Rest, stay hydrated, and use honey for cough relief. Ginger tea helps nausea (CDC guidelines).
Cool compress for fever, steam for congestion, and plenty of fluids for mild symptoms (MoHFW).
Seek immediate care for difficulty breathing, persistent chest pain, confusion, or high fever >103°F (CDC emergency signs).
Call emergency services for bluish lips, severe dehydration, or loss of consciousness (WHO guidelines).
See a doctor within 24-48 hours for persistent cough with mucus, fever with rash, or worsening symptoms (MoHFW).

Use hand sanitizer when soap unavailable, wear masks in crowds, ensure good ventilation (CDC).
Avoid touching face, shower daily, don't share personal items like towels (MoHFW).

Get annual flu vaccine in September-October to reduce flu risk by 40-60% (CDC recommendations).
